intro: Boesenbergia petiolata, commonly known as the lesser galangal, is a rhizomatous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and cuisine. The botanical characteristics of Boesenbergia petiolata make it a valuable species in both horticulture and pharmacology.
